entries.meaning: Illuminated; irradiated; made brilliant or splendid.

verbs.description: irradiate (third-person singular simple present irradiates, present participle irradiating, simple past and past participle irradiated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, literary, poetic) To illuminate; to brighten; to shine light on.
examples: Thy smile irradiates yon blue fields.

entries.meaning: (transitive, literary, poetic) To enlighten intellectually; to illuminate.
examples: This book might irradiate your mind

entries.meaning: (transitive, literary, poetic) To animate by heat or light.
examples: you may subdue and conquer the temperament of your nature, to do all things well-pleasing to him, and that may irradiate and strengthen your souls

entries.meaning: (transitive, literary, poetic) To radiate, shed, or diffuse.
(transitive, literary, poetic) To decorate with shining ornaments.
(medicine) To treat (a tumour or cancerous growth) with radiation.
(transitive) To treat (food) with ionizing radiation in order to destroy bacteria.
